meanings.sent1: The heavy boxes were borne by the strong movers.
meanings.sent2: The groceries were borne home by the helpful neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten was borne across the room by the playful child.
meanings.sent4: The message was borne through the airwaves to reach its destination.
meanings.sent5: The love letter was borne across the ocean to reunite two hearts.

meanings.sent1: She borne the pain of loss with grace and strength.
meanings.sent2: He has borne the criticism from his peers with dignity.
meanings.sent3: The students borne the boring lecture with yawns and doodles.
meanings.sent4: The old tree has borne the storms for many years, standing tall.
meanings.sent5: The athlete borne the intense training regimen to achieve success.

meanings.sent1: The mother borne a healthy baby boy last night.
meanings.sent2: The bird has borne three chicks in its nest.
meanings.sent3: The apple tree borne delicious fruit every autumn.
meanings.sent4: The queen bee borne a new generation of worker bees.
meanings.sent5: The fertile soil has borne a bountiful harvest this season.

meanings.sent1: The roof was borne by sturdy pillars.
meanings.sent2: The weight of the world seems to be borne by his shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The fragile vase was borne on a cushion to prevent breakage.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility of leadership is borne by the elected official.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project was borne by the dedication of the team.
